text: i haven’t systematically analyzed this, but i don’t think Pluto knows that it needs to react to a change in your module. But if you rerun a cell that depends on the module it should be updated. I often just have a  function `tester() = “something”` that returns a word and i will change the word in my module and test that pluto is using the updated function.

text: For what it’s worth, i really like pluto, but i find that sometimes it reruns cells that shouldn’t really be re-run, which can be annoying if you have some long running analysis and if you have a lot of plots that things can get slow.

Yeah I totally understand you on that one. One of the reasons why I like Pluto vs Jupyter is that Pluto is all just self-contained. I get send a zip to someone and their Julia instance can just have Pluto up and running all within Julia in such an easy way. The Pkg manager in Julia is one of the best I've ever worked with.

While with Jupyter its an "additional" step to get it running to install Jupyter and make sure it connects well with Julia (even though I like the nonreactiveness of Jupyter sometimes)
